data.title: Smelly,rude staff ,false google search photos of hotel.
data.text: Let me start by stateing that i asked for a non smoking three diffetent times i questioned them about this due to past experiences elsewhere. I walked in the roim and immediantly was slapped in the face by this old stinch of cig. Smoke. So i went to the front desk was given a hard time about getting a second room so i asked for my money back mind u i had only had my key no longer than 3 minutes or so and was told i could not get a refund because i had already walked in the hotel. I was one of maybe three guest and one of which was at the front desk as well complaining of the skimpy towels with holes in them and a big dark brown smudge on one of them "saw this for myself the guest was highly upset with this" anyways i made due with my room as i hadno choice so i go to take a shower to find a corner of a condom rapper behind the toilet and a ball of hair. Could not get the heat to work so went again to thos front desk and the guy was rude about cutting the switch on. And three different times in one night it kept getting very cold so i again went to the front desk to have him tell me the breaker keeps cutting it off "i did not believe him" i think he was finding it hallarious to be honest. So next morning i ask to skeak with a manager and was greated by the owner and let me tell you something about this women...she is the most disrespectful non educated buisness individual i have ever met in my life. She told me she did not give a damn how i felt after we had some words about how disrespectful her staff was and about the rooms. I now understand why there was only two or three people there. And to top it off as i was leaving the housekeeper as i walked back in my room apparently saw me go to the front desk was in my room when i returned cleaning the room at 925 in the morning and the next day my credit cards and debit card all four had several purchases made from jet.com. i did however find out a month later after the investigation was over that it was her and did press charges the trial begins in two weeks from today. I do not recomment a soul to this hotel on there worse broke day.

data.title: Convenient location on S. Main St, High Point @ good price incl breakfast
data.text: Excellent location in center of High Point.  Room had strong odor when we first entered, but either it went away quickly or we got used to it.  Room was clean and well maintained but had signs of age.  Desk staff was friendly and helpful.  Breakfast included make it yourself waffles, orange or cranberry juice, pastries, and was not crowded.  We were only staying overnight for a business meeting the next day.  Room rate was very reasonable and the accommodations were certainly acceptable.  Bed was hard, but we enjoyed our stay.  Free Wi-Fi and free parking were both welcomed extras!

data.title: Convenient and clean
data.text: I am a traveling nurse that stayed in this hotel multiple weeks for short periods at a time. I picked this hotel for its convenience to the local hospital and it's quick and helpful check-in and out, as well as my always clean room, and very comfy pillow-top bed, not to mention the great wifi and tv station selection. Many days I would work to return and have a neatly made bed, and clean bathroom towels. For the price it really cannot be beat. However, due to the proximity to Main street there is some excess road noise, especially on the weekends, but this was manageable and expected. Also, some rooms had a faint musty smell, not the worst, but you can certainly tell the room were remodeled at some point.

data.title: high point market spring 2016
data.text:
nice people, clean rooms,self service breakfast,middle of high point downtown,
walking distance to the market,so very easy to all market places,free shuttle to all market places.
nice and helpfull lady on reception which is also the owner.
free parking

just the internet has to bit better please

data.title: Clean and adequate
data.text: The hotel was adequate for our 2 day stay.  Room was clean and comfortable.  The stay came with breakfast but on the 1st day the waffle maker was broken so the choices were slim and we chose to eat else where .  Would stay here again.

data.title: Clean and basic
data.text: Little motel with clean and basic rooms.  Stayed while visiting High Point University, which was a short drive away.  Not a bad section of town but quite desolate.  Beds were very comfortable but the towels were skimpy.  Worked fine for our brief visit

data.title: A clean, basic, low priced motel....trying to do the best they can.
data.text:
We normally don't stay in places this inexpensive, but the pictures looked ok, we were tired, and didn't see any reason to spend twice as much just to sleep.  

The motel is right down town...not the best area, but not terrible either.  The room was decent sized, clean, had a comfortable, king sized bed, an ok bathroom, and plenty of hot water.  I slept pretty well, but apparently there were a lot of late check-in's and maybe a wedding party, so my wife thought it was noisy.  She also thought the room had a smell...possible lingering from long ago cigarette smoke in the walls.

There is a modest continental breakfast with coffee, juice, muffins, cereal and do it yourself waffles.

It was obvious from the recent painting and a lot of fairly new looking stuff that the owners are trying to make the place as nice as they can.  TV was ok, there was WIFI, but not a very good signal.

data.title: Horriable!!!
data.text: My wedding was march 16th all my family and friends stayed there never again will I recemend this dump to anyone my mother and law found cockroachs in her room my brides maids room smelled like 50 guys peed on the floor I mean the smell was sooooo bad it hurt my eyes when I went in there to check her room out the people in the office are rude and don't give a crap tryed to get her money back and she was gonna stay at my moms they wouldn't do that NEVER EVER STAY HERE will also be turning them in to the better business beuro

owner_response.author: K P, General Manager at Townhouse Inn High Point, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate your review and have addressed the issues you noted.  Your friends money could not be refunded as she stayed in the room the first night, left in the morning to return between 5 and 6 pm asking for a refund for that night. Check out time is 11 am and we regret a refund could not be made late afternoon.  As to your other concerns, we did offer to change her room.  We regret that we could not come to an agreeable solution.  We would be happy to have you or your friend as a guest at anytime.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good experience
data.text: The stay was good over all. We had a problem with the heat only to find out it wasn't turned on from the office. After we told them it was turned on and worked fine. We stayed twice and the first time their was a flat screen in the room the second time a regular tv and my hubby was not to thrilled about that. The room was clean tv was a little fuzzy but we were out and about so it was fine. Front desk clerk did his job efficently but housekeeping came early one morning while we were still in the room we left and came back to realize that they didn't come back to clen the room or bring us fresh towels but all in al good stay.

owner_response.author: K P, Manager at Townhouse Inn High Point, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate your review and have addressed the issues you noted.  We will  be happy to have you as a guest at anytime.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: No Customer Service
data.text: At check-in, we were asked if our reservation for a non-smoking room was correct.  We said, "yes."  When we opened the door to our room we were hit with the pungent smell of cigarette smoke right away.  They did put us in a non-smoking room immediately without even apologizing for the mix up.  The next day, while getting ready for a wedding (reason for our stay), it began to get real hot.  I noticed that the air conditioner wasn't on anymore.  I went up to the front desk to let them know that it wasn't working and they turned around and flipped a switch.  Then said to me, "Oh, we didn't know anyone was in there."  So, after that someone knocks on our door and asks us to move our truck and dolly because it doesn't line up right with the parking lines.  First of all, no one else was staying at that hotel besides us and the parking lines weren't long enough for a compact sized vehicle let alone a truck with a dolly.  Why would they give their only customers such bad service?  Do they want to go out of business?  The location is horrible unless you are there for the town's furniture fair.  I think this is the worst hotel I've ever been to.

owner_response.author: K P, Manager at Townhouse Inn High Point, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate your review and we have addressed the issues that you were concerned about. We do apologize for the oversight in houskeeping.  We would be happy to have you and your friends stay with us again at anytime.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Female-owner can't be bothered with guest - so don't bother staying here!
data.text: A 3-night stay at this Econ Lodge was marred by the rude and unfriendly behaviour of the female owner; acted like she couldn't be bothered with having a guest.  I was one of only a handful of guests at the time.  Go figure -- so  please, please don't bother this lady and go somewhere else.  Definitely would not recommend this hotel to a friend!

owner_response.author: K P, Manager at Townhouse Inn High Point, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Although it has been sometime since you posted your review, we want you to know that we do appreciate your review and have addressed the issues you noted.  Our staff tries to be   courteous to everyone who stays with us and we are sorry that you felt that we were not courteous to you.  We would be happy to have you stay with us at anytime
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Clean, friendly, good value
data.text: This hotel is situated in downtown High Point in a decent area.  It is clean and well kept.  The bed was good, although the pillows were lumpy.  There is free wi-fi, fridge, and a coffee maker.  Wayne, the night manager is very friendly and helpful.   CONS: it is a block from the fire station which we only heard once in the evening.  It's also 2 story and I don't think they have an elevator.

owner_response.author: K P, Manager at Townhouse Inn High Point, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate your review. Thank you for the nice remarks.  We would be happy to have you as a guest at anytime.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: NOT BAD, BUT NOT GOOD EITHER
data.text:
Hotel was very convenient to everything and easy to get to.  The only problems were that we reserved a smoking room, so when we entered the room, it was really stale and stinky.  We sprayed the carpet with carpet fresh and sprayed the room with lysol.  There also had been no ice bucket liner or cups left, and the packet of coffee had been opened with no cups or creamer packets left.  But, the continental breakfast in the lobby was WONDERFUL!!  Fresh waffles with all the fixings, juice, great coffee with flavored creamers, cereals, pastries, etc...couldn't have ask for better!  All in all, we had a very pleasant stay!
Thank you!

owner_response.author: K P, Manager at Townhouse Inn High Point, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Although it has been sometime since you posted a review, we would loke to thank you for your review and have addressed the issues you noted.  We would be happy to have you as a guest at anytime.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not a bad place
data.text: It's not the  Ritz-Carlton but it was a great place to meet up with old friends and Family. We had a family reunion there and we all had a great time.  The room were clean. When you checked in we had a problem with the shower head. We called the front desk and we had a new one instilled right away. The parking lot doubled as a meeting ground. Really nice.

owner_response.author: K P, Manager at Townhouse Inn High Point, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We appreciate your review and are glad that you and your family had a good stay with us. We would be happy to have all of you stay with us during your next family function.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
